page.title: 01SOUTH-EAST NORFOLK-A SUMMARY
page.content: The landscape of East Norfolk evokes mixed responses.To some it is flat and uninteresting,to others it holds a fascination.The marshlands West of Great Yarmouth are man-made.The Romans found a great expanse of shallow sea rather like the present Rhine estuary and built fortifications at Caister to the North and Burgh Castle to the South to defend the river route.Over the centuries offshore sandbanks and silt-laden rivers steadily choked the estuary .The skill of 16th Century Dutch refugees produced the present scenery , with its raised river banks;drainage dykes;and now derelict wind pumps. Only isolated dwellings are located on the marshes,nucleated settlements are universally located on the higher and drier land.
